physics.title: Intro to Mechanics
physics.subject: physics
physics.description: 15 classes in total. Will be taught by Sidhant Chaliha, who was admitted by Princeton University early and double bronze medalist in the USA Physics Olympiad. He graduated from Basis Independent Silicon Valley's Silicon Valley campus in 2024. This course is suitable for students with little to no prior physics knowledge, from 7th grade onwards. It is recommended that students have a basic understanding of algebra.
physics.content: Physics at a high-school level, covering topics found in AP Physics 1 and AP Physics C: Mechanics.

chemistry.title: Intro to Chemistry
chemistry.subject: chemistry
chemistry.description: 10 classes in total. Will be taught by Derrick Liu, a rising sophomore at Johns Hopkins University majoring in Chemical Engineering (Pre-med track), and Emily Dai, a rising sophomore at UC Berkeley majoring in Chemistry. Both instructors have extensive tutoring experience. This course is suitable for students with little to no prior knowledge in chemistry, from 7th grade onwards. A basic understanding of algebra is recommended.
chemistry.content: AP Chemistry topics including matter, gas laws, chemical bonding, reactions and more!

economics.title: Intro to Macroeconomics
economics.subject: economics
economics.description: 10 classes in total. This course serves as a survey of the typical topics covered in an introductory high-school level macroeconomics class. A more detailed list of topics is provided below, but the topics closely resemble those found in the AP Macroeconomics curriculum. This class is usually taught at the late high school level; no prior knowledge is explicitly assumed. Familiarity with basic Algebra is strongly recommended.
economics.content: High-school level macroeconomics, covering topics such as monetary policy, fiscal policy, supply & demand, and trade/exchange.

biology.title: Intro to Biology
biology.subject: biology
biology.description: 10 classes in total. This course serves as a survey of the typical topics covered in an introductory high-school level biology class. A more detailed list of topics is provided below, but the topics closely resemble those found in AP Biology. They are taught at the late middle school or early high school level; no prior knowledge is explicitly assumed.
biology.content: Covers biochemistry, cell biology, genetics, evolution, etc. Great for USABO/Science Bowl prep.
